intro: Capnites integrilobus, commonly known as the smooth-lobed capnoid, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Capnites integrilobus is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for its antiseptic and anti-inflammatory effects. Due to habitat loss and overharvesting, it is considered endangered in many parts of its range.
